(4) 1968: First Light for API

Source: Ira W. Cotton, Frank S. Greatorex, "Data structures and techniques for remote computer graphics", Proceedings of the December Fall Joint Computer Conference AFIPS '68, Pages 533–544, https://doi.org/10.1145/1476589.1476661

(8) From the Human Web to the Machine Web

  • 1990: First server at CERN
  • 1993: NCSA releases Mosaic browser
  • 1995: Amazon
  • 1998: Extensible Markup Language (XML)
  • 2000: SOAP
  • 2000: "Internet as a Service": Salesforce, eBay, Amazon
  • 2003: "Building Blocks": Delicious, Flickr, Facebook, Twitter, Foursquare, Twilio


A Brief History of API Management Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: Quo Vadis, API Management?

Source: Mark O'Neill



The Present: API Management Today Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: Quo Vadis, API Management?

(15) Diversity in the API Space

  • More API styles
  • More deployment models
  • Larger set of API users
  • Growing landscape of service providers

(24) API all the APIs



The Future: What to look out for Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: Quo Vadis, API Management?

(25) AI all the APIs

  1. APIs for data ingestion for GenAI
    • Data contracts with clear terms of service
  2. APIs for consumption by GenAI
    • Patterns and standards for AI-friendly APIs
  3. APIs for GenAI-powered services
    • Metadata for provenance and limitations
  4. GenAI-powered services for API management
    • The Great Unbundling (API all the APIs [API all the APIs (1)])


But … What Does That Mean?

Outline (But … What Does That Mean?)

  1. A Brief History of API Management [9]
  2. The Present: API Management Today [7]
  3. The Future: What to look out for [4]
  4. But … What Does That Mean? [3]
  5. Conclusions [2]
But … What Does That Mean? Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: Quo Vadis, API Management?

(27) API Developers

  • Learn about API trends and tooling
  • Explore and possibly challenge API guardrails
  • Talk to your platform team: It's good for everybody


But … What Does That Mean? Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: Quo Vadis, API Management?

(28) API Platformers

  • Build open platforms that can grow and evolve
  • Observe and explore the ever-evolving API landscape
  • Screen tooling for automation and composition capabilities


But … What Does That Mean? Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: Quo Vadis, API Management?

(29) API Vendors

  • Drink your own champagne and practice API-First
  • Use openness as differentiation: Not everybody has it
  • Create stories that contextualize your product: Show the bigger picture


Conclusions

Outline (Conclusions)

  1. A Brief History of API Management [9]

Conclusions Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: Quo Vadis, API Management?

(31) The Great Unbundling is Happening

  • Accept the growing complexity of the API space
  • Embrace the increasing richness of the API space
  • What we need are better ways to make tools talk


Conclusions Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: Quo Vadis, API Management?
